verses.verse: In the year <S%H8141><s%> that Tartan <S%H8661><s%> came <S%H935><s%> unto Ashdod <S%H795><s%>, when Sargon <S%H5623><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria <S%H804><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> him <S%H3898><s%>, and he fought against Ashdod <S%H795><s%> and took it <S%H3920><s%>;

at that time <S%H6256><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> spake <S%H1696><s%> by <S%H3027><s%> Isaiah <S%H3470><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Amoz <S%H531><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Go <S%H3212><s%>, and loose <S%H6605><s%> the sackcloth <S%H8242><s%> from off thy loins <S%H4975><s%>, and put thy shoe <S%H5275><s%> from off <S%H2502><s%> thy foot <S%H7272><s%>. And he did so <S%H6213><s%>, walking <S%H1980><s%> naked <S%H6174><s%> and barefoot <S%H3182><s%>.

And Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Like as my servant <S%H5650><s%> Isaiah <S%H3470><s%> hath walked <S%H1980><s%> naked <S%H6174><s%> and barefoot <S%H3182><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> for a sign <S%H226><s%> and a wonder <S%H4159><s%> concerning Egypt <S%H4714><s%> and concerning Ethiopia <S%H3568><s%>;

so shall the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria <S%H804><s%> lead away <S%H5090><s%> the captives <S%H7628><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, and the exiles <S%H1546><s%> of Ethiopia <S%H3568><s%>, young <S%H5288><s%> and old <S%H2205><s%>, naked <S%H6174><s%> and barefoot <S%H3182><s%>, and with buttocks <S%H8357><s%> uncovered <S%H2834><s%>, to the shame <S%H6172><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>.
And they shall be dismayed <S%H2865><s%> and confounded <S%H954><s%>, because of Ethiopia <S%H3568><s%> their expectation <S%H4007><s%>, and of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> their glory <S%H8597><s%>.

And the inhabitant <S%H3427><s%> of this coast-land <S%H339><s%> shall say <S%H559><s%> in that day <S%H3117><s%>, Behold <S%H3541><s%>, such is our expectation <S%H4007><s%>, whither we fled <S%H5127><s%> for help <S%H5833><s%> to be delivered <S%H5337><s%> from <S%H6440><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria <S%H804><s%>: and we <S%H4422><s%>, how shall we escape?
